Objection: not relevant irrelevant to the subject matter of the suit and will not lead to the discovery of admissible evidence
The proposed discovery goes beyond the subject matter of the case and reasonable expectations of obtaining information that will aid resolution of the dispute.

request would require the responding party to create a document not in existence. A party is not required to produce a document or tangible thing unless it is within the person's possession, custody, or control. A document that does not exist is not within a party's "possession, custody, or control." The only exception to the rule involves the factual observations, tests, or supporting data of a testifying expert.
